page.title: 10FARMING part 1.
page.content: The area is mainly of small hill farms most of which are owned by the farmer, though some of the farmers are tennants of the Milburn Estates or other smaller landowners. Many farms have sheep. These are mainly Scottish Blackface, Swaledale, Leicester Blueface and Suffolk. Many of the sheep graze mainly on the moor. Dairy Farming,in which the milk is sold to the Milk Marketing Board and is collected daily from the farm by a Tanker.The Dairy cows are mainly Friesan,Hereford,Charolais and Black Angus.An Ayrshire Herd also sells milk locally. Some farmers keep grant aided suckler cow herds. A grant is given to farmers running suckler cows on poor quality high ground.These produce calves which are later sold for beef. {See Page 11 for more about Farming
